content.description:
ZMBM 5.7 ** 80' F (6b)

Begin about 20' right of NCW just left of the dead juniper tree and climb the low angled arête to the headwall at the top (with 2 ring anchors over the top). Very nice.
content.location: 2nd from left on slabby right side.

content.description:
TRIANGLE OF DARKNESS 5.10 80' TR

Climbs directly through the rotten band and bulging overhang to the 2 bolt anchors on the headwall above the big ledge (just right of the pine). Not particularly recommended since only the upper half involves any good climbing.
content.location: begin just right of First Thought Best Thought

content.description:
ROUTE ROT 5.9 * 90' TR

Begin behind the large Pine at the cliffs base, climb the lower diagonal leaning cracks to the rotten mid-band, climb on to the upper face below and right of the pine tree and to the two cold shut anchors. Quite an adventure, with a lot of variety on questionable rock
content.location: 2nd from left (TR from cold shut anchors)

content.description:
NOT ALWAYS SO 5.10a ** 80' F (7b)

Start at the far right side of the main cliff, climb the lower diagonal slab, and mount the broken overhanging band on the right side. It just gets better after that. Cold shuts and single bolt anchors are just below the top lip.
content.location: right end of the main cliff

content.description:
NEVER CRY WOLF 5.7 * 75' F(6b)

Climbs the low angle slab on the far right through the steeper broken band to the 2 chain anchors around to the right. Better than it looks, but the upper half has some bad rock.
content.location: 1st route on the left end of the slabby right side of Sleeping Turtle Rock

content.description:
MOCK TURTLE 5.3 ** 70' F(5b)

About 200' directly north of the Sleeping Turtle outcrop, begin in the corner behind the serviceberry trees and climb directly up the shallow groove on the SE facing wall to the chain anchors on the lip of the top roof.
content.location: On the upper wall just north of Sleeping Turtle Rock. Approach from the Frog Pond trail and scramble up the 3rd class gully just north of the Sleeping Turtle Rock climbs, the route is on the face to the right.

content.description:
LEFT OVERTURE 5.11 *** 100' F (9b)

This route climbs the narrow band of excellent rock about 20' left of the large Pine at the cliff's base (directly below the old gnarled mostly dead juniper at the top), and is way better than it looks. The crux is short (passing the 3rd bolt), but the rest of the route is consistently interesting all the way to the 2 chain anchors just below the top.

FIRST THOUGHT, BEST THOUGHT 5.8 *** 90' F (10b)

This was the first route bolted at Whistler Canyon. A bouldery start leads to excellent, varied and sustained climbing punctuated with good rests. Climb the middle of the face directly below and left of the pine tree. 2 chain anchors on top (beside the large pine). You may want to take a large (#3) cam to place between the 2nd and 3rd bolts, but it's not essential.
content.location: On the first open wall on the left side of the North Canyon, climb the middle of the face directly below the pine tree on top.
